title: Replace itinerary management with item management

requirements.summary: Remove all itinerary-related frontend pages, components, and routes
acceptanceCriteria: All itinerary routes are removed from App.tsx
Itinerary navigation link is removed from the header

file_operations.description: Remove the ItineraryPage component that displays user itineraries with product references, date ranges, notes, and locations
Remove the AdminItineraryManagementPage component that provides admin interface for creating, editing, and deleting itineraries
Remove the ItineraryForm component used for creating and editing itineraries with product selection, date ranges, notes, and location entries

Remove all itinerary-related route definitions (ItineraryPage and AdminItineraryManagementPage routes) from the router configuration. Remove imports for ItineraryPage and AdminItineraryManagementPage components. Ensure the header navigation no longer includes the itinerary link.

requirements.summary: Remove itinerary-related React Query hooks from useQueries.ts
acceptanceCriteria: All itinerary query hooks are removed from frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts
No compilation errors after removing itinerary hooks

file_operations.description: Remove all itinerary-related hooks: useItinerariesQuery, useCreateItinerary, useUpdateItinerary, and useDeleteItinerary. Remove any itinerary-related imports and type definitions. Ensure remaining hooks continue to function properly.

requirements.summary: Add quantity field display to ItemCard component
acceptanceCriteria: ItemCard displays the quantity value from the Item type
Quantity is clearly labeled and visible on each item card
Quantity display updates when item quantity changes

file_operations.description: Add a quantity display to the ItemCard component that shows the item.quantity value. Place it near the price or in the badge area. Use clear labeling such as 'Quantity: X' or 'Qty: X available'. Ensure it updates reactively when the quantity changes.

requirements.summary: Implement item sorting on the storefront by categories and subcategories
acceptanceCriteria: Items are grouped first by category (Ceramic, 3D Printed)
Within each category group, items are sorted by their shape subcategory
Sorting is applied automatically on the storefront page
Sorting works with existing filter and sort controls

file_operations.description: Add a new sorting function that implements two-level sorting: primary sort by category (ceramic vs printed), then secondary sort by shapeCategory within each category group. Integrate this sorting logic with existing ViewMode filtering and price sorting functionality. Ensure the function returns items sorted first by category, then by subcategory alphabetically within each category.

Apply the new category-subcategory sorting logic from storefrontListing.ts to the items displayed on the storefront. Ensure this sorting is applied after filtering but works in conjunction with any user-selected sort options. The default view should show items grouped by category and sorted by subcategory within each group.
